titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford Jazz Orchestra Collection ARS.0090
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Franz Kunst

publicationstmt.p: The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.descrules: Prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection size
physdesc.extent: : 7 half-inch open reel tapes ; 14 videocassettes (ADAT) ; 4 DATs ; 1 compact disc

did.abstract: Studio master recordings from the Stanford Jazz Orchestra.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research; material must be requested at least two business days in advance of intended use. Contact the Archive for assistance.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with repository. Publication and reproduction rights reside with the creators or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Head Librarian of the Archive of Recorded Sound.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stanford Jazz Orchestra Collection, ARS-0090. Courtesy of the Stanford Archive of Recorded Sound, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Source
acqinfo.p: The Stanford Jazz Orchestra Collection was donated to the Stanford Archive of Recorded Sound by Fred Berry in 2003.

processinfo.head: Sponsor
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced with generous financial support from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Stanford Jazz Orchestra Collection consists of studio master recordings for two compact disc projects recorded at The Music Annex in Menlo Park, California. The studio changed owners in 2003, and the new owners offered the masters to Stanford. These materials include half-inch reel masters, videocassettes (with ADAT audio), DATs, and notes on studio sessions (take sheets, mix notes, microphone lists, personnel). The resulting compact disc from the first session was also included in the donation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Recordings released as a limited (1000 copies) CD in 1999. Drummer Louie Bellson guests on two songs; "Who Brings You the Good News" and "Your Wake-Up Call." Other songs by Wayne Shorter, Cedar Walton, and Marian McPartland.

did.unittitle: 1998-1999 Stanford Jazz Orchestra with Special Guest Louie Bellson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CD booklet includes personnel, track listing, liner notes by Herb Wong, and photographs of the recording session.

physdesc.extent: "Play on ADAT machine only" Maxell S-VHS (XR-S Black ST-180)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: May and October 2003 recordings released on CD as "Bridging the Gap" in November 2003. Produced by Fred Berry, engineered by Tom Carr.

did.unittitle: DATs: Mix Safety Masters 1-3, CD Safety Master
